content.description: Most likely the longest Trad route at Laclede. Boulder the thin crack left of a menacing looking off-width to a small ledge at the top of the off-width.  Placing your first piece could be tricky (first crux).  Then, continue up steep terrain stemming and jamming your way to easier ground and leads to a square overhang(2nd crux, 9+/10a).  Climb left of the overhang making some interesting stemming moves.  A few more feet brings you to a small tree and a crack.  Sling the tree and plug a #1 or 2 BD and belay your partner up.  You may be able to set up a Top-rope.  I recommend extending your runners as far past the tuft at the top as possible to keep from bring dirt down on your head.  The more it gets climbed the better and cleaner it will get.  Walk off the top in either direction.
content.protection:
Standard BD rack to 3"

Extra #1 and 2 might be helpful.

A set of chalks are very useful.

8 shoulder length runners.

Cordelette or extra runners for the belay.
content.location: Park at the West Pullout.  The route can be found on the Land Shark Buttress.  The tallest Buttress in the Lost World area.  Follow the trail from the Utility Pole buttress following along the base of a series of cliffs(note all the quality routes as you pass by).  The start of the route is located just right of Land Shark(11c) and left of a menacing looking off-width.  Walk off the top in either direction.  Bring your pruning sheers and help keep the trails clear for future climbers.  Some of my favorite climbs are at West Pullout.

content.description:
Climb up to the arete and once you reach it, use it along with delicate holds to reach the anchors. Thin feet once you reach the middle of the route.

The guidebook created by J. Luthy has this route as a mixed line with 3 bolts and gear. When I climbed this in June 2020 I counted 7 bolts to an anchor. If this is incorrect please let me know and I will correct this description.
content.location: Located at the West Pullout. The route can be found on the Destruction Buttress to the right of California Slab. Follow the trail from the east end of the pull out.  The start of the route is located just right of Arizona, a 10b mixed line.

content.description: The crux is between the 1st and 2nd bolt. Reachy moves and may be more difficult for the shorter climber. Positive holds if you can reach them. A top rope can be set up by walking to the top of the climb. Lots of lichen near the anchor that will clean up with more climbs.
content.location: Located on The lost Buttress, 1st route to the climbers left. The hike to this buttress is roughly the same distance from either end of the west pull out.

content.description: Thin low angle climbing up a very aesthetic crack On the Spokane slab. Last brushed January 2021. Has one bolt near top but there are placements for a .1 and 0 BD Z4 instead if you trust them.
